Reviews.Title: Good enough.
Reviews.Author: inabon
Reviews.Content: Background: Hobbyist photographer, other cameras are a Nikon D300 and a Nikon D40 with a plethora of lenses. Main purpose for buying this P&S; is for lightweight travel and taking it to restaurants, etc w/o the bulkiness of a DSLR, and a camera that I could hand to someone else to take a photo of me + family, you cant do that with a DSLR.I took this camera on a 10 day road trip to Disneyland and San Diego, I took several hundreds pictures with it and something like 30 videos so my review is based on this experience.Pros:- size. its small enough to carry with you yet beefy enough to use with big hands, as far as P&S; go, this is a great size, in comparison, the new Canons are just too small for big hands.- fast autofocus (instant when outdoors).- scenes work (but read cons).- battery life for photo taking is not horrible.Cons:- absolutely horrible battery life when taking video. If you take three five minute videos, prepare to not have a full day of battery, taking video EATS the battery.- scene mode: They take too long to select and you cant change the ISO on them, which means you'll get grainy pictures.- flash: it really is too underpowered, you cant take a family photo 4 feet from the camera at night, true, you can fix it later, but, still, flash could be WAY better.- 16M photo size: When using this size, the write speed to the card is horrendous, almost unusable for some of us (even with top of the line sd cards), my recommendation, use the 12M setting, the size is big enough for big prints and you get good write speeds.- charging trough USB. I prefer taking out a battery than removing a rubber gasket to connect a usb cable., however, it charges pretty fast.- odd focusing; I don't know if this is an issue with MY camera, but mine back focuses too much, (back focusing refers to: you focus on someone's faces, the focus point shows where it focused but then the focus point on the photo is actually behind the point you wanted, making the photo unusable)- lack of photo info: when taking a photo, it doesnt show you what ISO was used when using Scenes, which means you have to zoom into the pic to see if its usable, this is a big flaw in my opinion.Conclusion:- This is not a P7100 or a Canon G12, this is a basic P&S; that does one thing good, be basic (and the price proves it). Do not expect to be blown away by the quality of the pictures unless you took them outdoors and forced the ISO to be 200 or below, everything else will be good enough pictures. Would I recommend it? I guess I will with the caveats I mentioned, with the case logic travel case you can put it on your belt and have it with you all the time, thats a big bonus. Case Logic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage (Black)UPDATE: Tips & Tricks:- Two scenes work really good: Night Landscape & Sports (outdoors), the rest, not so much.- Change the photo size to 12M, it gives you a 4000 x 3000 sized picture, enough for most size prints, and the camera feels way faster with that setting on.- ISO 200 is really clean, if you can, leave it there, ISO 400 is not as good.

Reviews.Title: Very nice basic P&S; camera
Reviews.Author: DrBob
Reviews.Content: This camera satisfies all of the criteria that might be applied to a small, versatile and relatively inexpensive point and shoot camera.> excellent exposure under most conditions, color balance very good> works well in low light without flash> fast focus, reasonably quick recycle time> excellent menu, limited of course by lack of manual controls> excellent battery life> nice wide angle lens with good zoom range, useful for both party and travel scenarios.Suggest purchase of external charger and second battery since included charger only works with the battery in the camera.I am very happy with this camera.  It is better than several higher-end cameras I've owned due to their exposure, focusing or low-light problems, none of which are a problem in this camera.  I would suggest this camera to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Robertson
Reviews.Content: Recently used my new Nikon COOLPIX S6200 for our family Thanksgiving/Christmas get together and was very pleased.  The pictures are vibrant in color and are amazing in quality.  The zoom works well and I was amazed at the way I could include a large area and group in one scene and it still have such good detail quality.  It does have a slight hesitation before the picture actually snaps which caused me to miss some great shots of my little grandchild, but I'm still learning how to use it.  Overall, I love the compact size of the camera, and the quality of the pictures, and am sure I will love it even more as I learn how to use it better.  Thanks to Amazon for your great service again!

Reviews.Title: Comparable to my old Canon, so far
Reviews.Author: Snappy mom
Reviews.Content: I'm writing from the perspective of a working mom with school-age kids in sports and band. I received this camera as a gift, and have been testing it all day. I wanted a new camera with a better zoom than my Elph, which is now around 5 years old. At this point, I do not perceive a major difference.* I keep recording video accidentally due to the button's location in the upper right corner of the back of the camera, where I often place a finger to stabilize things. This is a major problem.* There's a slight delay between the time you press the button and the time the photo is actually taken, another major problem if kids or animals are your subjects. I'd be more positive about this if the reason for the delay was better focus but...* The focus in general seems tricky, and no more reliable than my old Elph.* The zoom is stronger, but once again, focus is a problem.* The "night" camera option is not much better than my Elph's regular abilities.* The camera's beeps are loud - everyone around you will know when you turn it on and when you delete photos.* Which reminds me, the on button is very small! Not sure how this would work for someone with big hands.* Definitely purchase a second charger and battery. Otherwise, you'll need to plug in the camera like you plug in your phone.* The camera itself is rather large, as large as my old camera, which makes sense given the longer lens, except that longer lens does not seem to produce better results. Will not save space in my purse.At this point, I kind of get the feeling that the new camera has a lot of bells and whistles (the sepia option is one thing I really like), but is not much better in performance than my old camera. It may be that if you are looking for a better camera, you need to consider an SLR. Or it may be that this was meant for folks who don't already own an Elph or something comparable.

Reviews.Title: just turn on and shooooot
Reviews.Author: bassele
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about the coolpix for a while. After a little research I decided to get one, my first nikon camera after the canon. The camera is great and takes beautiful sharp pics with ease of use. Since i like to take far views, the Nikon optical zoom worked great for me. For those who are frequent shooters who doesn't like the burden of complicated cameras, this is the one. I highly recommend. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: Good for most conditions
Reviews.Author: Deb - Mom of 3 Girls "DebMomOf3"
Reviews.Content: This was my first Nikon camera - I've owned point-and-shoots from Canon and Kodak before. I wasn't happy with the quality of my last Kodak camera and wanted to replace it with something that would take better photos, especially in low-light or indoors with flash. I compared this camera to the Canon Elph 500 and ended up choosing this one because it felt better in my hand and the settings felt more intuitive. Plus, I was curious to see how Nikon would compare to my previous Canon point-and-shoot.This camera works wonderfully in most settings. It is definitely easy to use and the menus feel very intuitive to me. It's easy to change scenes or use different flash settings. I have not used it to take video, so can't comment at all on that functionality.The only times that I've run into any problems are in very low-light situations, especially if trying to take a photo from some distance away - the flash doesn't reach more than a few feet, resulting in photos that are very grainy and dark. Also, every so often the camera won't focus on the specific thing that I'm aiming at, making it necessary to make sure that I'm taking at least a few shots of anything that I want to make sure to capture. Honestly, that's something I would do normally anyway, just to ensure I don't miss a critical shot though.For most purposes (mine are taking family photos indoors or on-the-go) this camera works perfectly well and I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent Cheap Camera, Lousy For A Nikon
Reviews.Author: Imran Anwar
Reviews.Content: I love the pictures Nikon cameras take (see flickr /imrananwar for some examples) but each of my Nikon S6, 5700 and D300 ended up having to go back to repair manufacturing or design flaws. Cannot stand the 100% failure/defect ratio of a fancy expensive company like Nikon.I did not buy this at Amazon (which has always been a great experience to shop from, but adding this review to help other buyers. This Coolpix 6200 was bought to replace the (repaired) but working S6 6MP and to supplement the times I cannot carry the D300, and where the otherwise excellent for day time shots iPhone 4S 8MP camera would not excel, e.g. where real zoom helps (sunsets), large group photo with a flash), etc.First off, this Nikon (Coolpix 6200 being sold in) 2012 camera may as well have a built-in floppy drive. That is how long it takes to save a photo. Literally 5-6 seconds PER photo. Forget quick shots of some cute action like kids or animals (yes, some people's kids behave like animals, but that is a whole other review LOL). It has fair but paltry 720p video capability where the iPhone 4S has 1080 and quite good.The flash is not very powerful. The best thing about it is its red color :) . And the fact that it has a real zoom lens. I only bought it because I had a $25 reward/rebate from Staples, on top of it's price of $149 that day. So, for $125 (which was less than the cost of ordering some flimsy and hard to carry iPhone 4S zoom lenses, etc.) I got a real 3rd camera, and won't stop you from buying it for such use. As a primary camera, spend your money on a camera that actually has moved up to data writing speeds for this century.The overall colors of the photos are not bad, and better than the S6 in some situations. However, it has a truly poorly designed little plastic tab covering the USB port, which requires multiple nail insertions to pop, and always at the guaranteed risk of breaking off. It is almost like Nikon hired someone to design something as poorly as possible for such a basic thing. Also, on more than one occasion the camera will scare you by not displaying the images it took and saying that the card in it it unreadable. The card works fine in this and the other cameras it was tested in.So, get it at cheapest cost as a supplemental camera, but NOT as a primary camera. Click Yes if you find this review helpful.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Look Elsewhere
Reviews.Author: New Hampshire
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a compact point and shoot in the $200 range that took sharp pictures with good image stabilization.  My old Canon Powershot SD750 (which I was very happy with) died recently and I needed a replacement.  I tried 5 different cameras, and the picture quality on all of them was alful:1.  Panasonic DMC-FH25A2.  Nikon Coolpix S62003.  Canon PowerShot SX230HS4.  Canon PowerShot SD980IS5.  Canon PowerShot Elph 100 HSThey all got returned.  I finally found the Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-HX7V and I am THRILLED with it.  I never would have thought that a Sony camera would outperform comperable models from Nikon and Canon (WHAT has happened to Canon in the last few years?), but the difference is absolutely night and day.Conclusion: pass on this one and look at the Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-HX7V.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great for a compact point and shoot
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: Got this camera a couple of weeks ago.  It takes great pictures for a point and shoot.  Zoom stability is good even at 10x.Menus are easy to understand and navigate, or you can just set it to automode, which also works well.  Editing software that comes with it is very user friendly.Have not tried out recording videos yet, but then I didn't buy it for that anyway.This is an ideal camera for a novice who just wants something compact and easy to use out of the box that takes good photos.16mp and 10x zoom for a Nikon this small and under $200 is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Buy Another Product
Reviews.Author: Des Hope "Des Hope"
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrible.  I tried to return it but don't have the box so they won't take it back.  I had no idea I would be returning it.  I have a Nikon D90 and it's wonderful, however, I always use a compact camera for ease in traveling local and away.  The pictures are distorted like they were taken in a fun house.  By the time you take the picture, either the person taking the picture has moved the camera or the subject has moved, thereby creating a blurry picture in either event.  The lag time is lengthy and there's no way to correct that setting.  Steer clear of this camera.  I presume it's okay for novice photographers, but I'm a bit more advanced and have greater expectations of my pictures, whether I'm taking them or in them.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S6200
Reviews.Author: Kahmaro
Reviews.Content: A very nice camera that can easily fit in a pocket. Very small and lightweight from what I'm used to, but I have to get used to not having a viewfinder. Very easy to set up and get started. Haven't had a real chance to do much photography yet, but this is what I wanted, small and easy to handle. No dangling cover for the lens; it takes care of itself. Great feature.Great dealer who delivered as promised. I like this so much better than the 6100 where you have to touch your screen all the time and it's full of fingerprints. Good pricing! I was able to purchase a few extras, like an addition battery and still beat a local price on the 6100, which I returned.

Reviews.Title: I Like It....
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good for it's price.  I bought mine at Adorama for 149.00 new..had an instant 50 dollar rebate!! I think now they went up. Please check there first, before buying yours!  You have to keep checking for bargains.  Anyway, I love the way it looks and how it feels in the hand! It feels like it has a strong build, so I hope it doesn't ding or dent easy. I suggest to keep in a case, if you keep it in your purse.  Maybe even wrap it up in a soft no lint cloth.  My  Coolpix S8000 dents in easy.  Only had one dent...by the pop up flash..but I fixed it myself and it's fine.  Worse place to have a dent..by a pop up flash..anyway.. back to the S6200..the front of the body has a matte finish and the camera I bought is black..so it looks nice.  I don't know about you, but I don't care for all the other colos.  I stick with black.  Looks more adult / professional. I do, however own a red Olympus water resistant fun camera...and a red JVC camcorder..a tiny one.  Ok..back to the S6200 again..LOL.  I seem to like the photo quality so far and I love the color select filter....leaving out all the colors except the one you want.  Great quick video record button on the back and the scroll wheel is great.  The battery seems to get used up quickly but I read that it's from heavy use of the video and I did use the video a bit. So, buy a spare one! They take a EN-EL12 sized battery.  I guess this is a power house of a camera, but it does a lot of nice things.  I do recommend the Coolpix S6200 to you...it's more affordable than the other coolpixes in the 8000 and 9000 range of numbers.  Some don't like this camera...but most do..and I am one that does!  As picky as I am, I am very pleased..so far!  Only had it a few days...It's not as long as the Coolpix S8000...by a half inch..I like that. Great zoom.  Takes a decent still photos with minimum shake.  Still working or figuring out the best setting for low light...finding the best mode for indoor low light. So..keep looking here, because I may adjust this review.  Look at some of my uploaded images that I took from the Nikon Coolpix S6200.

Reviews.Title: Nice P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: modula2
Reviews.Content: I have only had the S6200 for three days.  It has performed without any problems for me and has taken photos in varying light conditions.  I am not a "photographer" and the P&S; features work very well for me.  The only thing I do not like is the absence of a REAL PRINTED manual.  The only manual is in electronic format.  Too bad.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: ao
Reviews.Content: This camera is, to me, a piece of junk. I took it with me on my trip to Hawaii and found it EXTREMELY frustrating because it doesn't adapt well to different lights, even if you switch the settings...I tried ALL of them, and they all seem to have more problems than just the regular auto setting. GOD FORBID your subject is moving even slightly when you are trying to photograph lets say... anything, you will get a blurry image AND have to wait about 5 seconds for the camera to "record" .. so if you're trying to take a picture of an animal, if you don't get the shot on the first try, forget it, by the time the camera goes back to normal that thing will be gone. I can't wait to return this thing. Like I said, I tried all the different settings, even the animal portrait one, which is supposed to take continuous pictures.. well, it takes 3, and if by continuous you mean three pictures with a 2 second delay in between.. then, no thanks. I'm usually pretty good at working cameras, but I found this to be incredibly frustrating and an insult. i don't know if there is a better model nikon out there...but I would suggest if you like to take pictures other than the typical people posing still in front of you..then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: JohnH
Reviews.Content: The camera is very intuitive and I have hardly needed to reference the manual.  I like the size and the optical zoom.  The screen is nice and so far it is taking very nice pictures.  I am by no way an expert or anything when it comes to cameras...but I do like stuff that works right and this does.

Reviews.Title: Love it and my boys don't take it!!1
Reviews.Author: Leta A. Stoddard
Reviews.Content: So far I have loved my camera.  I have not tried out all the various options, but for me the automatic options and the ease is what I was looking for....also my teenage sons rarely want to use it thanks to the girlish color!!!

Reviews.Title: Total Waste of Money...
Reviews.Author: mommyoftwo
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a Christmas gift and within 6 months (still brand new, hardly used at this point), the camera would not focus at all and all images were blurred. Nikon service agreed it was defective and "replaced the lens and adjusted the flash". It was returned to me completely unfixed...all images still blurred. Sent new images in for evaluation and was told there was definitely something wrong and I would need to send the camera in again for further hands-on evalution. I received the camera back simply with a letter stating "we cannot replicated your problem. The camera is in proper working order." The camera now sits untouched, as it will not take an image that is not blurred. So dissappointed in the workmanship of this camera and even more dissappointed in Nikon's service. The camera is still under warranty and is completely useless to me!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S6200
Reviews.Author: mana
Reviews.Content: Gave camera as a gift. It replaced a Nikon S4100. My niece was thrilled. The camera is far superior than its predecessors. The optical zoom is amazing and the HD quality movies is stunning. Considering the price of $229.00 it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive point and click
Reviews.Author: Dr. "Oceanfront"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for someone who does nit have a smart phone, and his only camera used film...no, I am not joking.  I didn't even know they still sold film!  ;-)When he opened the present, he absolutely loved the camera.  However, he was completely baffled by the concept of a camera without film ( he is 65 ).  I honestly did. It expect that kind of reaction, and I didn't want to see the camera sitting in a draw.I had a friend walk him through the simple steps to take a picture.  Then I had them bring the SD card to a place like Walgreens so he could experience the instant gratification of seeing his prints in person immediately.The pictures were as good if nit better then his other pictures ( I am not going into detail on that!).Two weeks later he couldn't figure out how to turn back on the camera and guess what...it is sitting in a draw somewhere.  :(Well, at least I tried, and I can't blame the camera.Next, it's on to his getting a smart phone...NOT!!

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: B.Battulga
Reviews.Content: i liked very nice i liked good price. taking very nice shoot. i taking night shoot quality is nice. i give this my brother he is two liked this camera

Reviews.Title: l love it.
Reviews.Author: Larry L. Hoard
Reviews.Content: Well priced arrived in just days. It's the best small camera I have ever had. It does things you would expect from a much more complicated camera.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: richard velazquez
Reviews.Content: excellent product important to the family would buy again if needed, durable and recommend it to everyone is required to have

Reviews.Title: Stable and sharp
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just got this in time for my mom's visit....image stabilization feature was the main attraction for me, since I have Essential Tremor (google it; makes most cameras unusable for me).  Well this little camera takes such quick shots that I rarely if ever take a blurry photo anymore!  And the continuous shoot feature helps as well, since I can set it to take several pix at a time of the same shot and then choose between them later.Would definitely recommend this for someone with shaky hands who just wants a beginner's point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Heather N. Higgins "Domestic Diva-Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: My husband uses this camera for work everyday for work and it takes clear and beautiful photos! You would be wise to buy this! It even has a panoramic feature with a previous photo line up assistant. It works great!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Amers
Reviews.Content: I hadn't planned on getting this camera. I was going to get one of the lower end cameras. My husband convinced me to go for this camera. It was a great price on the amazon.com website. Cheaper than in any of the stores I visited. I love the pictures that it takes. I have an SLR camera but wanted one that I could carry in my purse for all of the other times it's nice to have to carry around the big camera. I also have a camera on my phone. This camera is MUCH better than the phone camera. The S6200 takes amazing pictures!!!! So glad I got it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S6200
Reviews.Author: 4funbgoofy
Reviews.Content: So far I have only taken a few pictures and i'm very impressed with the quality of them. Camera is extreamly easy to use. For being such a small camera the buttons are easy to access with big hands or small hands. Because it is so small you MUST use the wrist strap because it is very easy to drop. I would have purchased the memory card at the same time if the description would have stated there was not one included.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Wearyj
Reviews.Content: I am definitely pleased with this camera. It is easy to function and takes high quality photos. The buttons are a little stiff but I am sure this will correct itself overtime.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Leo Schneiider
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81EBt3JWfVS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4preplay.parentNode; var cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4currentClick) { return cv_mo3H8MDWIQWF2K4currentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:00 MinsMy first camera :D Only thing that pissed me off was that I spent $180 on it and now it's like $100 lol. With enough light, pictures and videos look amazing. It's not too good at night and the zooming for video is annoying just like most cameras like this. Battery life is amazing, just turn it off when you're not using it. Honestly. You can make the battery last for days. It turns on super fast so it's worth turning it off even if you're going to use it again after 1 minute. It's auto settings are really good. Manual settings are too slow to change but the auto is so great you might as well leave it there. The 16mp on this is really good. Again, with enough lights in the shot, you're able to zoom in quite a lot into the picture and it will still be really clear and nice. Exposure compensation is freaking amazing and fast to change. I mostly use this camera for videos and the 720p settings on it are great. I wish it would record at 60fps (Would have made the video muuuch better) but hey, for $180 you can't expect a gopro. For the head mount that I used in the video, it's just some scrap metal I taped together and put on a hat (Go Ghetto HD) lol. Super light camera, I take it everywhere and always carry it to school. Definitely worth the price. Check my youtube channel, most of the videos were taken with this camera :) [...]

Reviews.Title: Average at best
Reviews.Author: ken liddell
Reviews.Content: This camera is average at best not great photos actually less quality that my phone but didn't expect that much so it's ok

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Warmbaby31516
Reviews.Content: This camera does all that I need, it takes a clear and beautiful pictures.My friends and family comment all the time how professional my pictures are.

Reviews.Title: Great pics
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: Was a gift for my daughter and she loves taking pictures with it. Easy point and shoot. great zoom. Love it

Reviews.Title: use as a gift to my GF and she enjoy it
Reviews.Author: Ching C Shieh
Reviews.Content: I have this camera as a Christmas gift to my girlfriend two years ago and did not rate it until now,She really like it and carry in her bag everyday,you can not find a better gift ,it is lightweight and very easy to use. a great ideal for gift...

Reviews.Title: Already not working
Reviews.Author: S. Peart "Fashion guru"
Reviews.Content: I've been using Nikon cameras since my first camera as a kid.  I loved this camera until it decided to just not turn on a few months after I got it.  I've never dropped it or gotten it wet or any other ill treatment because I'm extremely careful when it comes to every one of my electronic devices.  I don't know what happened.

Reviews.Title: Problems Focusing
Reviews.Author: Jaymi McClusky
Reviews.Content: Great overall easy to use camera, but it seems to have a focusing problem. When taking pictures in low light WITH THE FLASH ON half the pictures come out completely our of focus (not blurry from low light, but completely out of focus) and I have to take the picture again.  Usually on the second try it comes out perfect, but its a pain.  I returned the camera because of this and got another one, but it still happens with the replacement camera.  In daylight, pictures come out beautifully.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Bon
Reviews.Content: GreatEasy to use and takes great pictures in all different situations.  Small enough to take with me anywhere and usually do.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: bimbo kohen
Reviews.Content: This unit does all I need. Good value for the money. Easy to use and takes great photos. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: you wont regret it!
Reviews.Author: Julissa
Reviews.Content: this camera it is worth every penny, pics are awesome!, the quality is really good! is a good investment. i love it

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Michael Focazio
Reviews.Content: So easy to use. takes amazing pictures. My mother said it was one of the best presents she had ever gotten.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: Karly Fasth
Reviews.Content: i love this camera. the only thing i have an issue with is at night when the flash goes off sometimes it ruins the image, but if you take the flash off it is kind of blurred i find. but then the video is great, pictures are awesome. i love the price for this camera, i have had it over a year and it is still holding up pretty well. one other issue i find is that i cant always get things in macro even when the setting is on but maybe i just need to explore that more, i dont spend much time taking macro photographs so its not much of an issue.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Ashley Losie
Reviews.Content: I ordered this because I wanted a camera for taking pictures at sporting events. It's not a horrible camera, but the zoom isn't as good as I expected. It gets really pixelated and blurry if you zoom too far. I would not recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Florida Native
Reviews.Content: The camera zoom is really good. Pictures are clear. Camera is compact and pretty. Great price and easy to use. Will likely buy another one for another family member.

Reviews.Title: Auto focus can't cope.
Reviews.Author: ashley metcalfe
Reviews.Content: The auto focus drove me crazy. it is completely and utterly unable to auto focus on objects that move even slightly, even pictures of a group of children standing stationary! For instance, when focusing on a group of people, the camera can not decide which person to focus on and so it just keeps trying. When it does eventually focus, the slightest sideways movement of one person simply restarts the process! Considering that there is no manual focus, the camera is therefore useless. Avoid like the plague unless you want a cheap party camera.The time between shots is also very very slow.......it take ages to 'store' the previous image which means that you can't shoot again for several seconds unless you use the multiple shot mode which we could not get to work either!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6200
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!! My fiance bought me this camera for my birthday last year and I carry it everywhere I go. The pictures are always so crisp. This is the best point and shoot camera that I have ever owned. I ended up buying a newer model for my mom for Christmas last year and when my camera was dropped and broken, I quickly ordered a new one. I recommend this camera to anyone looking for a nice point and shoot to take with them on the go. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Valuable for Price
Reviews.Author: Indrasena reddy G
Reviews.Content: its good camera ....best for its price......if they provide accessories like memory card and camera pouch it should be better

Reviews.Title: It's OK but not great for a Nikon
Reviews.Author: JR-Texas
Reviews.Content: This is a small point and shoot digital camera.  It takes high quality photos and videos.  However, it's difficult to focus and shoot quickly.  If you have plenty of time to let the auto-focus find faces and focus then it's fine but not great for quick shots.  The display is large enough but very dim in bright daylight.  If does not have a viewfinder to address this problem.  The camera powers itself down at odd times and is not quick and easy to reactivate.  The on/off button is not easy to depress.There is some pretty good software provided with this camera.  Especially, the slide show application.I would suggest that someone looking for a good point-and-shoot pass up this camera and look at something a little better but not necessarily more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Just Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Gaurav
Reviews.Content: Perfect point and shoot camera. I bought this one for my relative and they liked it. This camera took nice pictures in the day time.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Briana Harris
Reviews.Content: I switched from a lesser megapixel camera that was larger to this little blue beauty and I love it. I would recommend this to somebody who wants a very easy camera that takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Amber Lozano
Reviews.Content: i wanted something small and cute... this camera does everything i need it to. Only con is that if you take a video it eats up your battery.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It has great quality for the price. Good size. Only bad thing is that it can only hold about 10 images without an SD  card in it. Hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is Amazing !!!
Reviews.Author: rene lopez
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX S6200 16 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom NIKKOR, Excelente Camara facil uso, realmente adorable Thanks, todo bien sin contratiempos

Reviews.Title: Friend Buy it
Reviews.Author: Doris.ec
Reviews.Content: Really nice camera more than she expected for that price love it and that is all that I have to say about this product!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazingly clear and vivid pictures. My only complaint is that it's kind of slow at focusing, the camera works very hard. And it's very compact for this much zoom

Reviews.Title: Wedding Gift
Reviews.Author: Crow Spenser(WI) "auntiesuspect"
Reviews.Content: This purchase was a wedding gift.  My niece and nephew took it on their honeymoon and said they took 1000's of pictures.  They love the camera and all the different functions it has.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Brittney
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera on eBay and thought I was getting a great camera. I was in the market for a new camera as I was going to see KISS on 8/29/2012 and wanted decent photos. My current camera was a Samsung with a 3x zoom and took poor quality photos at the last concert I went to (Bret Michaels). So I thought this camera would be better. I was standing about maybe no more than 30 feet away from the stage. So I thought a 10x zoom would be best (or at least better than a 3x zoom).I did not change any settings before going to the concert. And it took decent photos from where I was sitting. Sometimes if I went more than the 10x zoom the pictures got really blurry. It did take a few seconds for the camera to start up and I had to hold down the power button to get it to even turn on. Instead of just clicking it quickly to turn on like my Samsung. The video mode was great. I got some really good shots of the band (Gene's fire breathing, Paul's flying over the crowd, the finale, the opener, etc.). But it wasn't the best quality. If I zoomed in all the way to the 10x zoom the picture got really blurry and you couldn't see anything. So I couldn't really zoom in very far.I took about 5 total videos and 30 photos throughout the day (not leaving the camera on the entire time) KISS was playing with Motley Crue and the total concert went for about 4 hrs. And my battery was about half way down from it's full charge when I got home. The photos at night turned out great after I tweaked them at home. I used the flash the entire time and it really dimmed out the bright lights around the band for good shots. But still some of them turned out blurry or too bright.The photos themselves turned out great, that means the ones that I didn't zoom into too far. But still great shots, though the band members still look a bit tiny. The videos turned out a little weird. Some shots were perfect. Like when Paul flew into the crowd he was about maybe no more than 15 feet from me and that video was good. But maybe it was just the bright lights. But some of the shots made the band look like the bright white lights. But I'm guessing that was lights. But still decent quality videos for night shots.All in all a good decent quality and much better than my 3x zoom Samsung for concert photos. I will probably still use this for future concerts (go to quite a few of them). But may look for a camera with a better zoom for better close up shots.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cooklpix
Reviews.Author: Judy1944
Reviews.Content: We did research prior to deciding on this camera.  It has lots of great features.  It's easy to use.  The zoom wroks great to get a better look and a better picture.  For what it has and what it does, the price is really good.

Reviews.Title: Best thing bought
Reviews.Author: DragonBorn
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best thing I have ever bought for someone! I got it for my mom for her birthday because she wanted it and since my sister said it was too much money, i decided to buy it. She was so touched. It really is an excellent camera. It has 10x optical zoom plus another way to zoom in more. It is amazing and is a wonderful price! I was shocked at how much it was! It's wonderful. Highly reccommened it to any peole looking for great cameras.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M. Mann
Reviews.Content: While planning to leave for vacation, I needed a new camera fairly quickly and under a certain price. I went to Best Buy hoping they would have what I wanted. However they said they would need to order, and needless to say after 10 days of waiting and them telling it was not on the truck as they had promised, I canceled the order and went straight to amazon. Since I was in a hurry to get what I needed, with the 2 day shipping, I didn't expect to see the UPS man at my door THE NEXT DAY. The shipping was incredibly fast and the price also beat that of Best Buy. I believe it's safe to say that is the last time they will be seeing me step foot into their store. The camera is just perfect size for traveling and is everything I was looking for!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: The camera takes some very nice shots. At Christ-mas I found it for a very good sale price. The 10X zoom is really a charm.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S6200
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Lov the pics & the video is amazing. Don't like the color i choice(black) and its a bit bulky. Over all I lov it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: ASDFGHJKL
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It has a slightly slower shutter than my old camera but it just took a litte getting used to.  It takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...Pretty fast shutter
Reviews.Author: dariey
Reviews.Content: Pretty good camera.  So far I am extremely happy with my purchase.  The shutter on the camera is pretty fast.  The one downfall on the item is the battery life.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s6200 16 mp
Reviews.Author: mafu
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Excellent picture quality. Really like the zoom feature.Excellent soft ware package for picture editing. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: boccigallupo
Reviews.Content: I put off getting a digital camera for some time but now am pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this Nikon s6200 is. I still have my N50, with  3 Nikkor lens but do not see 35mm film at Costco anymore. Progress ha!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Gurliaccio
Reviews.Content: great little tak-a-long camera. fits in your pocket and is easy to use. bought it for my wife who doesn't like things too technical and this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: filbert19
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my girlfriend for Christmas and man does she like it. This little camera does it all. Take my word for it, get one.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Computer tech
Reviews.Content: I got this Camera to replace a Kodak point and shoot that was crap. It works for me I take a lot of pictures for eBay stuff like that it works great. takes great videos no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: buzz
Reviews.Content: Great product and very fun to use. Thanks so much for your service and prompt delivery. Hope to do business with you again soon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6200
Reviews.Author: Josh Meaders
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and has great flash photography. Also, the effects are great, and has an amazing sepia tone. And this is cheaper than the Canon Powershot we have for family purposes. And, that is only a 12 MP. Just wish it was touchscreen

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Timm Luhrsen
Reviews.Content: This camera has stunning video and pictures.  It is so easy to operate and is very small and compact.  For the price this camera cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: great camera, perfect condition
Reviews.Author: David F. Butler
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use, point and shoot. Takes great pictures with clarity and professional quality. Zoom is very powerful and doesn't cause picture to blur like other ca,meras

Reviews.Title: Worst camera bought ever
Reviews.Author: Pankaj Kumar
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be the worst camera I ever bought. The camera shutter has some issue. When powered on it is blackish. nothing can be seen through the lens.Very poor quality.

Reviews.Title: The HD Photos Very Clear
Reviews.Author: Peter Gaffney
Reviews.Content: Even zooming in as large as the camera will allow, the pictures are very crisp and clear. The many features that the camera has (color saturation, scene mode, 10x zoom, and a battery that holds a charge forever!) are easy to use and don't take a pro photographer (I'm definitely not) to take great compositions. I said it that way because you can do a lot more than just take snapshots.I still don't know how to use all the features but it's not that hard to pick it up. The controls can be a little daunting at first, but keep on using it and you will be taking some really great shots!I was doing a study on these three trees in my backyard and I took literally, hundreds of shots of these trees. I tried different times with different light and one of the results I liked so much that I blew it up and  had it put on canvas. People always remark how clear it looks and are very surprised when I say I took the shot!If you are a complete novice to photography as I was (am?) then this camera will help you go a step further!

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: Loi
Reviews.Content: Disappointing--pictures are not sharp, and the delay before and between pictures makes capturing that special shot an exercise in frustration.  It's pretty.  But functionally very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: you will love this camera
Reviews.Author: bbbbadwizard
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a carry around as I have several high dollar Nikon SLR's.  Took it on vacation and the pictures were better tha I ever expected.  Recommend to anyone needing a small pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I expected...
Reviews.Author: natsuhime87
Reviews.Content: So I searched up a few reviews before I purchased this item and the reviews were pretty good, so I went ahead and bought it. Not the best purchase of my life. I mean it takes SUPER crisp pictures as it should with a 16MP lens... when it has the right lighting. When the lighting is a little off, the picture comes out blurry. But a retake would fix that. My biggest problem with the camera was the video recording. The buzzing noise the camera makes when you zoom in and out while taking a video is pretty noticeable. Unless you are at the club with REALLY loud music, you'll be able to catch the buzzing in the background which is pretty annoying. I really really thought about returning it but just got too lazy so I decided to keep it. But if I could go back in time, I might just go ahead and get a different camera instead.

Reviews.Title: Efficient Delivery
Reviews.Author: MARILYN KAUFMANN
Reviews.Content: I was more than delighted that The Nikon Coolpix was delivered so quickly just in time for Christmas ~ especially since I had lost my husbands camera. It came in perfect condition and it far surpassess my husband's other camera in picture quality and overall performace. Thank you

Reviews.Title: WORTHLESS WARRANTY SEE Better Business Bureau
Reviews.Author: Daniel Milton Shelor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in may of 2012. I used this camera for 5 months and then lost image on one half of the LCD screen,so I sent it in to Nikon for repair under warranty.Nikon contacted me and told me I would have to pay over one hundred dollars to get it fixed even though it was under warranty.I checked with the BBB and found out Nikon has a F-Rating with the BBB at their repair center and that they had 199 complaints at that time.I wished I had have checked BBB before I bought the camera.I WILL NEVER BUY NIKON PRODUCTS AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as other Nikons I have purchased
Reviews.Author: JimCDenver
Reviews.Content: This would have been our third point 'n shoot digital Nikon, but I am returning it to Amazon. I have been a Nikon owner since 1978, so if anything I have a great deal of pro-Nikon bias. But right out of the box it produced very poor images. Overexposed flash images were the rule, so I adjusted the exposure to minus .7 or more and then there was a lot of noise in the image. One would think that the Auto setting for quick P&S; would produce reasonably good images, but that was not the case. We never could get good indoor images from it. It's a shame, as we love the Nikon D3100 DSLR we have at work and hoped a new Nikon P&S; would produce good images for family documentation.

Reviews.Title: Beaware of this seller
Reviews.Author: MD RAFIKUL ALAM
Reviews.Content: Feels cheated...was a open box item and used signed was there. Started battery was full charged and factory setting was modified.

Reviews.Title: Yikes, disappointed
Reviews.Author: guhnd
Reviews.Content: Wanted the perfect compact camera to have when on the run with my children. The lightening on the pictures was not always the best and my flash stopped working for no reason. Be aware that once the flash goes, the camera is done.

Reviews.Title: To whom it may concern
Reviews.Author: jerry johnson
Reviews.Content: Have yet to receive accessories kit that goes with camera, which is limiting its use!!!!! Goodbye, Goodbye, Goodbye, So long!

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Sasidaran Subramaniam
Reviews.Content: This camera is an average camera. Good for convenience and average snapshots, definitely not your best buck for quality. The night mode is horrible. I recommend a better camera even if you're just going for an average quality photo.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Flabius
Reviews.Content: Image quality is horrible, what can we expect form this level of product ? I bought it for my mother. This is for people that do not care about image quality, since 5 mp or 16megapixels or even more in a camera like this means nothig, as the proof is the bad image quality. This is perfect for people that do not know how to take picture and dont care about bad quality. The images shown on the propaganda on amazon ad of this product seens the where shot with a better camera with a better sensor. Don't be fool, never buy a camera because of what the seller shows you as 'actual image quality', to give and example of what the camera can do, research if you want for a better low quality camera, or pay extra for a mid-range non professional.

Reviews.Title: You can get a better one
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: First of all I bought this camera after returning an Olympus VR350 (which had good quality, but didnt seem good enough at the moment).So, I decided to go buy this Nikon. ("it's a nikon, what can be wrong?" i thought)well, if you taking pictures of big things like buildings the quality is pretty good.but if you're taking portraits the people look just way too RED. also, in distances under 20 ft the auto focus didnt work very well. =/and -if there's a little movement- the pictures look blurry.when recording the images (in qualities over 4MB)it took at least a couple of seconds to be ready to shot another frame.Well, I got rid of this Nikon and buying (again)the Olympus VR350.

Reviews.Title: Hate everything about it but video, which eats batt.
Reviews.Author: trailrocketgirl
Reviews.Content: Fuzzy pictures, grainy, must edit to get any kind of quality shot. Have a few remarkable photos, but only with 200 ISO and outside in relatively clear weather. Worst camera for outdoor adventurers. The size is portable and it takes good video, except that kills the battery in nothing flat so you get few shots if you take any video. I have so many lost shots of wildflowers and summits in overcast weather. I have the few greats I mentioned because the weather was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6200 fuzzy pictures
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Ducote
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 4 months. I take a LOT of pictures with any one of my 4 cameras. I am not new to photography. I've owned about 10 different cameras over the last 20 or so years.Maybe it's just me, however, I have never been able to take a picture with the Nikon S6200 that came out even borderline good. All appear to be fuzzy and/or out of focus.I switched to 5 mp and found that it was better than with 16mp however, it still isn't as good as my old Fuji finepix 2650, 2mp camera.I did notice that it seems to take relatively good video. I don't normally do video's with my still cameras but decided to try, just to see if there was an improvement in the quality. Maybe the moving picture hides the fuzzyness.It's a small handy camera and I do intend to continue trying to get better quality photos from it.

Reviews.Title: Not A Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Candee
Reviews.Content: I thought I was "winning" when I bought my first Nikon with a 10x zoom for under 200.00 but I was wrong. The camera is really tiny and the time to take another picture takes really long. At first I thought the camera froze so I took the battery out but it did again...it paused for a long time. I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone. I bought this for an upcoming Disney trip and with the mega slow shutter I am going to have to Craigslist this buddy. I bought because it was pink, cute and it has a 10x zoom. I am lucky I bought in advance so I can buy the Sony that I really wanted instead.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing...more of a 2.5 star review
Reviews.Author: KLJ
Reviews.Content: When my reliable old Canon A530 finally bit the dust, I jumped at the chance to buy a Canon SX 20 IS.  All the ease of a PowerShot, but the zoom and some of the features of a "fancier" camera.  After a while of lugging it around, however, I realized that I still needed a camera I could throw in my purse or backpack for long hikes or nights out on the town.  A Canon loyalist, I perused the selection and was disappointed to find that Canon didn't offer a cheaper, pocket-sized camera with at least 10x zoom and reasonable battery life.  (The main sticking point was the battery life.)  So, having heard plenty of people rave about the Nikon Coolpix series (and figuring that Nikon vs. Canon is like Ford vs. Chevy - different in their own ways, but both perfectly good), I took a leap of faith.  Nikon had come out with the Coolpix S6300 by that point, and the folks at Best Buy said that the only significant difference was the video quality.  The S6200 was cheaper and I didn't care about video, so I bought one.I MISS CANON!!!  Maybe my S6200 is a fluke, but the reliability / ease of use leaves a lot to be desired.  I'm not even an intermediate photographer, so I can't speak to image quality (they look pretty good to me, for the most part), but just TAKING the picture is a problem.My complaints:1.) It seems like you have to hit every button twice.  Twice to turn the power on, twice to get the zoom function to "realize" you want to zoom, twice to use the scene selector, etc.2.) The actual "take the flippin' picture, already" button is not responsive.  Many digital cameras have a bit of a delay, I realize that.  But this is AWFUL.  It's like the camera can't figure out what to do.  I've pressed the button, pressed the button and held it for 10 seconds, pressed it twice, pressed it three times...depending on the situation, sometimes it takes the picture, sometimes it waits 5 seconds, and sometimes it never goes.  This happens in auto mode as well as the scene selector modes.3.) Half the reason I chose this camera was for the scene selector mode.  My old Canon had a similar function that resulted in some great pictures.  With the S6200, some of the scene modes work better than others, but the sports mode does not work at all.  I'm not really sure what the intent of sports mode is, if not to "freeze" motion in a picture.  I've used it a number of times in a variety of light conditions, and the image is blurry every time.In short, I'm sure Nikon makes great cameras - just maybe not this series.  Spend a little more money, or try a different brand if you want a cheaper point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S6200 16MP
Reviews.Author: Louie
Reviews.Content: The camera looks nice, it is compact and light.  But the picture quality is not that good. I have compared the Nikon Coolpix S6200 16MP with the Panasonic Lumix 14MP.  The Panasonic has a sharp and clear picture; in other word, the 14MP Panasonic produces better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out of box
Reviews.Author: A. Sampra "ELECTROMAGNETIC GUY"
Reviews.Content: Didn't work out of the box.  Charged battery, second battery and still nothing.  Returned for refund.  What else can I say.

Reviews.Title: Say Cheese  in Hanover NH
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Dear Customers of Amazon,The 2 reason why I buy so much stuff on amazon is first the price is so good and cheap on anything you buy.  2nd reason why I buy stuff on amazon is the reviews they are awesome.  Now Lets talk about the Nikon COOLPIX S6200 16 MP Digital Camera 1st it is easy to set up and use.  2nd it is a 16 MB camera for under 150.00 you can't beat that for a brand new camera.  3rd it takes amazing clear photo's 4th the camera had free shipping on like most anything amazon sells. 5th it shipped fast to my address.  Shutting up now and hands getting sore from all the typing by now JB [[ASIN:B005IGVXU2 Nikon COOLPIX S6200 16 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and HD 720p Video (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: An excellent camera for the price you pay. Very satisfiedI have already recommended getting one to one of my friends.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: jcf123
Reviews.Content: I previously owned Nikon S220 camera which I loved, the battery lasted almost 2 weeks whilst on vacation without having to charge, when that camera finally died I decided to stick with Nikon. I noticed the S6200 on sale and now realize why IT IS AWFUL the battery does not hold a charge, I sent camera in 3 times under warranty and they kept sending back saying everything is fine, battery depleted. I can fully charge camera and go to use it one week later and battery is dead. Since then something has happened to charger and cannot use camera at all.Only had camera 6 months. I loved my previous Nikon but am skeptical about buying from them ever again. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY, there is a reason this camera is on sale,trust me it is not a great deal, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the average Joe
Reviews.Author: rwags
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for just about one year and have no complaints. It's great for when you need something a few steps up from your cell phone camera. It's perfect for traveling. I do not have a case for it. I just throw it in my purse and go, and there is no noticeable wear on it. I am not a photographer. I do not use this every day or even every week. It's very easy to use, great for the average person who just wants a camera.

Reviews.Title: Pink Nikon
Reviews.Author: Jerzy
Reviews.Content: I am really disappointed in the quality of this camera. The seller did a great job and all that jazz; however I am disappointed with this Nikon. For a point and shoot with the price tag and the supposed great shots, it is a POS and very difficult to use. I cannot stand this camera and am going to spend the real money to get my fiance a real camera than this. The Nikons that are priced cheaper and more compact than this camera have better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: amazon fan
Reviews.Content: I've been a long time (happy) customer of Canon point and shoot cameras.  My last one, SD800IS Elph, finally quit working after years of reliable results - and I take a lot of pictures.  I also have a Canon SLR, but my pocket camera covers FAR more ground when I'm on the go.  The SLR is great for creative photo shots when I plan ahead for special events, but nothing beats a good reliable point and shoot pocket camera to have with you when lugging an SLR isn't practical and you still want to capture the moment.  So, when my 800IS camera went out, I naturally looked for a Canon replacement.  Long story short, all indications are that Canon has really let the quality of their Elph series slip significantly in recent years since my last purchase.  So, I opened my search up to Nikon pocket cameras.  While all cameras have their detractors, you have to look at the overall context of the various reviews.  After reading a lot of reviews, I eventually talked to a guy at a camera shop (that carries both Nikon and Canon cameras) and he recommended this model.  So, when I saw it on sale at Amazon a couple months back, I jumped on it.This camera is almost identical in size as my former Canon SD800IS.  The optical zoom on the Nikon is very good (much better than the my Canon), and I like to use a lot of optical zoom (avoiding digital zoom).  The photo quality also seems to be good.  Also, the features of the Nikon are also fairly easy to use (however, the manufacturers are now focusing on adding too many features 98% of point and shoot owners will never use, rather than keeping focus on improved image quality).The one thing I can't get past with this Nikon is the location of the Video Record button.  Nikon placed it right where you naturally grab the camera with your right-hand thumb.  You can't avoid but push the button with your thumb when you pick up the camera to take a shot - there is no other place to put your thumb to grasp the camera!  I remembered seeing another reviewer complain about this, but thought it couldn't be a show-stopper since not everyone was complaining.  Even with the raised edges next to the button, I haven't been able to avoid pressing it, whereby missing my shot as I figure out what I did and to turn off recording before I can shoot.I have no idea why Nikon would place the video record button in that location!  I want a snapshot camera, not a video camera!  Shooting video from a pocket camera is a very small percentage of what I want a snapshot camera for.  I just want a great photo (in both bright and dim light), with basic features to help me get that shot (not the kitchen sink), which are accessible and easy to use, such as force flash on or off, zoom.I'm hoping I can adjust and get used to the placement of the record button so I can avoid pressing it all the time.  Given my track record thus far, I'm not hopeful.  I'm also considering putting a small piece of tape over the button to help me 'feel' the button and not press it!If you buy this, good luck!

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Mamma Lu "Mamma Lu"
Reviews.Content: Due to the poor picture quality of this camera, I returned it to Amazon as I was worried it was defective. There was nothing I liked about this camera other than the color.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Glorified Tin
Reviews.Author: Ann E. Picard "A.E. Picard"
Reviews.Content: What happened to Nikon! I got this for Christmas, broke right away. Slow slow, long pause between taking pic, and flash. Subject is long gone!

Reviews.Title: Dont bother
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: My Casio exlim died after owning it several years and so i thought i would go for a little nicer camera and go for the Nikon Cool pix s6200 ....the day i got it could hardly wait to test it out. I bought a new memory disk for it making sure i was using the correct memory disk. Well day one i was not impressed by the lack of speed this camera had, i wasnt impressed with much of any of it. The picture quality wasnt any better than my Casio Exlim and the overall use wasnt as easy as my exlim. I have had this camera about 6 weeks now and i am just requested a return on this item, the last few days i cant get the "ok" button just stopped working. The "ok" button is the select botton so i cant change any of the settings or watch any videos on the camera. I do not know if i just happened to get a bad camera but first impressions are alot and this put a sour taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: Loretta
Reviews.Author: Loretta
Reviews.Content: the quality of the pictures are not very clear.  I was a little disappointed.  If you zoom in (which the zoom is good), the pictures are ALL blurry.  Overall, I wish I picked something better.

Reviews.Title: Oh well!
Reviews.Author: raptor "the cat"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great value for the price and good if looking for a point and shoot (I was.) My only qualm was the day after I ordered this, my local camera store ran a full-color ad from Nikon at a lower price than Amazon!!  Unsually  Amazon is always the cheapest source.  Also Amazon had only the black model in stock at the price but the camera store with the lower price had the camera in all colors. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Q. E. Correll
Reviews.Content: I have always respected Nikon products.  So when I saw the S6200's specifications I "snappped at it" to get one ASAP as I was looking for a new "point-and-shoot" camera that is easy to carry and had high resolution and 10X optical zoom.There is so much sperhical abberation in the lens(system) that the camera is a total NO-GO for me.  TERRIBLY distorted image results!!!Unless you like your pictures to look like they were taken of mirrors in a fun-house I suggest that one stay away,... FAR AWAY, from this product!!!  Q

ProductInfo.Features:
10x optical Zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens in a compact body design
16 effective megapixel CCD sensor and VR image stabilization for sharp, clear stills and movies
One-touch HD (720p) movie recording with optical zoom and stereo sound (HDMI mini connector equipped)
Add creative touches to your photos and movies
20 Scene modes make picture taking point and shoot easy
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX S6200 16 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and HD 720p Video (Pink)
